result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Mast Borchardt

Zoom approved. Adjourned 9:05 AM. srb

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:23 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court. Defendant Melissa Mast Borchardt in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Unknown who will be assigned. DE is on a Probation Hold with Agent Ben C. Eau Claire Co. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Reserve on pre-plea rights. Court sets PH with Court Commissioner.
